MedAllies Network Council comments on Request for Information; National Directory of Healthcare Providers & Services
https://www.federalregister.gov/documents/2022/10/07/2022-21904/request-for-information-national-directory-of-healthcare-providers-and-services
First, we would like to congratulate the authors for a great job representing the benefits of a Centralized Managed Directory. We also appreciated that the benefits discussions identified the various use cases and where this directory will be critically important. We fully support a Centralized Managed Directory given that the Directory is accurate, does not increase burden, and is governed by a multidisciplinary stakeholder committee under CMS. We believe these characteristics will drive adoption of the Directory.
1. New Directory should be single source of truth
a. This Directory will eventually be the “Source of Truth” for all Healthcare Use Cases and therefore, all constituents will have access related to their required use cases.
b. Constituents must have the ability to electronically upload and download entries and changes from EHRs, and other HIT systems used by constituents, to and from the Directory
c. EHRs must have standardized forms and capabilities to ease burden of data entry/revisions
d. Data entered should be an incrementally evolving set based on use cases, with more data required with each use case
i. Suggest the first use case be billing and insurance then
ii. Clinical role-based provider information
iii. Provider Information required for clinical referrals
iv. Patient finding clinicians for care
e. Data must be validated and there must be incentives and disincentives for accuracy.
i. Accuracy is absolutely required. Recommend significant incentives as the primary motivation with eventual disincentives to ensure accuracy.
2. Directory Governance
a. Resides under CMS
i. Multidisciplinary Governance Committee representing all constituents, e.g., Clinicians, Payors, HIT professionals, EHR vendors, Interoperability Networks, patients, etc.
b. The Directory must have a Point of Contact and have a “Help Desk”.
